document.docAuthor: Figuerola, Blanca, Gordon, Dennis P. & Cristobo, Javier
document.docTitle: Amastigia zigzag Figuerola & Gordon & Cristobo 2018, n. sp.
document.masterDocTitle: New deep Cheilostomata (Bryozoa) species from the Southwestern Atlantic: shedding light in the dark

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New deep Cheilostomata (Bryozoa) species from the Southwestern Atlantic: shedding light in the dark

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology. ALLUDINg TO THE ZIgZAg ARRANgEMENT OF THE bASAL AVICULARIA ; USED AS A NOUN IN APPOSITION .
Material examined. HΟlΟtype: CRBA-58227, STN PAT 1208DR17. COLONY , AbOUT 40 MM IN HEIgHT, bRANCHES AbOUT 0.7 MM WIDE ; WITH PROXIMAL AND DISTAL PORTIONS , SOME bRANCHES bROKEN.

Description. COLONY ERECT , UNILAMINAR , bRANCHINg, COMPRISINg THREE LONgITUDINAL SERIES OF AUTOZOOIDS ; COLONY HEIgHT AbOUT 40 MM, AND bRANCH WIDTH AbOUT 0.7 MM. AUTOZOOIDS IN ALTERNATINg LONgITUDINAL SERIES , MORE OR LESS RECTANgULAR; AN OVAL OPESIA OCCUPYINg MOST OF FRONTAL AREA , COMPLETELY CONCEALED bY PROMINENT SCUTUM WITH SEMIELLIPTICAL PROXIMAL LObE, AND TRUNCATED DISTAL LObE THAT IS SOMEWHAT INCLINED FRONTALWARDS ; ATTACHMENT POINT OF SCUTUM MEDIAN OR NEAR-MEDIAN . ZOOIDS WITH TWO SPINES AT OUTER DISTAL ANgLE, ONE ON THE INNER CORNER . TWO FRONTAL AVICULARIA , SMALL , THE ROSTRUM PERPENDICULAR TO FRONTAL PLANE , HOOKED , WITH bROADLY TRIANgULAR MANDIbLE. AbFRONTAL SIDE OF bRANCH WITH MEDIAN ZOOIDAL SERIES EXCLUDED ; bASAL AVICULARIA PRESENT , ONE PER ZOOID , ANgLED ObLIqUELY PROXIMALLY TOWARDS THE NEXT PROXIMAL AVICULARIUM , FORMINg A SOMEWHAT ZIgZAg SERIES ; ROSTRUM AND MANDIbLE ELONgATE-TRIANgULAR. OOECIUM LONgER THAN WIDE , ECTOOECIUM MOSTLY MEMbRANOUS, ITS CALCIFIED MARgIN FORMINg A DISTINCT RIM AROUND THE EXTENSIVE SMOOTHLY CALCIFIED ENDOOECIUM ; PAIRED AVICULARIA OCCURRINg AT THE DISTAL END OF THE OVICELL , THE TRIANgULAR ROSTRUM POINTED ObLIqUELY OUTWARD. RHIZOIDS ARISE FROM DISTObASAL WALL OF MARgINAL AUTOZOOIDS .

Remarks. AMONg SOUTH ATLANTIC , SUbANTARCTIC AND ANTARCTIC SPECIES OF
Amastigia ,
SEVEN SPECIES HAVE ZOOIDS WITH LARgE SCUTA : A. abyssicΟla (KLUgE, 1914),
A. benemunita
( BUSK , 1884),
A. crassimarginata
( BUSK , 1884),
A. funiculata
(MACGILLIVRAY, 1886),
A. gaussi
(KLUgE, 1914),
A. magna
GORDON, 1986 AND
A. puysegurensis
GORDON, 1986.
A. zigzag
n. sp.
RESEMbLES A. abyssicΟla AND
A. gaussi
, bOTH FROM
ANTARCTICA
, bUT DIFFERS IN THE AbSENCE OF DISTOLATERAL AVICULARIA , A MUCH LARgER EXPOSURE OF THE ENDOOECIUM , AND A LARgER SCUTUM THAT IS ATTACHED TO THE ZOOIDAL MARgIN AT OR NEAR ITS MIDPOINT , NOT DISTALLY . FURTHER , THE bASAL AVICULARIA OF
A. zigzag
n. sp.
DIFFER FROM OTHER SPECIES IN ALTERNATINg IN A ZIgZAg MANNER
DOWN
THE bRANCH AND IN HAVINg MORE-ELONgATE TRIANgULAR ROSTRA AND MANDIbLES THAN
A. gaussi
. IN PARTICULAR,
A. benemunita
IS CHARACTERIZED bY THE PRESENCE OF bASAL AVICULARIA ON SOME MARgINAL AUTOZOOIDS AND , IN THE CASE OF
A. funiculata
, bASAL AVICULARIA ARE FOUND IN bIFURCATIONS.
A. crassimarginata
,
A. magna
AND
A. puysegurensis
HAVE bASAL VIbRACULA.
